channel.title: Gaming PC for £295.45/$462.50
channel.description:
£295.45 or $$462.85 (Just went up 35c :meh: ) Cheapest Equivelent: £439.95 or $688.70 Can anyone beat that? (Monitor, PSU, Keyboard, Mouse, DVD-Drive I'll reuse) Specs:
* Intel Core 2 Duo 2.93Ghz * 500GB HDD (Largest I have ever owned) * ATI Radeon HD 5450 512MB * 1x 2GB DDR2 RAM (Maybe another one for my birthday present)
And my case is this: [img]https://blog.solmetra.com/wp-content/uploads/2007/05/img_4232.JPG[/img] I'm building a PC into a super sexy Mac case.
List of the parts bought: [code]Intel-Desktop-Board-DG31PR-micro-ATX-Serial-ATA-300-LGA775-Socket-Motherboard Computer-Memory-2GB-PC6400-DDR2-800Mhz-240pin-DIMM Intel-Core-2-Duo-E7500-2-93Ghz-LGA775-Socket-Processor-CPU Western-Digital-Caviar-Blue-WD5000AAKS-500GB-SATA-Internal-Hard-Drive SPEEDLINK-SL-8871-SRD-A-Stage-7-1-PCI-Sound-Card Sapphire-ATI-Radeon-HD-5450-512MB-PCI-Express-2-1-Graphics-Card[/code]
I am taking room for people to tell me where I can improve for little or no extra cost, originally it was £370 but the graphics card i wanted is now no-longer sold and i have to get the HD5450 which hasn't come out yet in Jersey UK.
So any suggestions that will help me improve this please say, I want to play Black Mesa at at least 60FPS, I'm tired of the Orange Box being at 20FPS on full settings.
I don't know much about computer parts, so any suggestions at all, hell, tell me this is shit if you think it is, just throw and suggestions at me.
(I can not buy RAM and get it for birthday and instead get the Intel Core 2 Duo E7600 3.06GHz CPU adding, £2 to the price)

Patonki:

that case is fucking ugly

In the same sense that Half-Life1 is fucking ugly compared to Half-Life2.

This case is from 1999, it made computers look “cool” to the general public, as opposed to dull-grey cases that had been around until then.

item.title: Gaming PC for £295.45/$462.50
item.dc:creator: Cartel_Wolf
item.description:
Guessing that you have a ATX Case:

1 X Intel Pentium Dual-Core E5300 “LGA775 Core 2” 2.60GHz overclocked to 3.20GHz (800FSB) - Retail
1 X Gigabyte GA-P43-ES3G Intel P43 (Socket 775) PCI-Express DDR2 Motherboard
1 X Corsair XMS2 4GB (2x2GB) DDR2 PC2-8500C5 TwinX Dual Channel
1 X Arctic Cooling Freezer 7 Pro CPU Cooler

And you have enough money left for your 5450 Graphics card

ATI Radeon HD 5450

Sub Total: £279.99 or $438.26

P.S: I didn’t add HDD (am thinking you might have one awready) Hence this way you get a better System on you budget New HDD maybe for Birthday

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming PC for £295.45/$462.50
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
I’m assuming that case can take an ATX mobo, but let me know if it only fits microATX, as I don’t really know.

Anyhow:

MSI 770-G45 - $60

Patriot Gaming Series 4GB DDR3 SDRAM DDR3 1333 - $97

AMD Athlon II X2 240 Regor 2.8GHz - $57

Western Digital RE3 500GB 7200 RPM 16MB - $80

XFX HD-577A-ZNFC Radeon HD 5770 1GB - $160

$454 USD

Slight jump in HDD capability. Mobo and ram leave room to upgrade later, and you aren’t investing in outdated DDR2, which will come back to bite you if you look to upgrade. CPU is a bit of a step back, but the GPU is much more powerful. Since you didn’t post that you needed one, I didn’t add a PSU. The CPU isn’t going to limit you near as much as the 5450 was. These are newegg.com USD prices, so I’m betting the price will jump a bit in Europe, but it should still be close.

Read full topic

So any suggestions that will help me improve this please say, I want to play Black Mesa at at least 60FPS, I’m tired of the Orange Box being at 20FPS on full settings.
